article_text:
Thank you for your interest in licensing Fortune content. Please find information on various licensing contacts below and choose the one that best suits your needs:

1. To license Fortune articles, excerpts, or headlines for republication in various media (including books, eBooks, film, web, newsletters, newspapers, magazines and others), please email syndication@timeinc.com.

2. To license a Fortune cover, order reprint or e-print copies of an article or cover, or license an accolade, please contact PARS International at www.timeincreprints.com.

3. To license text only photocopies of Fortunearticles as print or digital handouts in academic settings, or in academic coursepacks, please contact the Copyright Clearance Center at www.copyright.com

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Philip Elmer-DeWitt

twitter.title: Will Apple rally next week like Google did on Friday?
twitter.description:
Google added $65 billion to its market capitalization Friday, the biggest one-day gain ever for a U.S. company.
Apple held the previous record, with a $46.4 billion pop in April 2012.
Google’...

article_metadata.keywords: apple, google, revenue, earnings, q3 2015, fortune 500
article_metadata.sailthru.tags: Apple, earnings, Fortune 500, Google, Q3 2015, revenue
article_metadata.news_keywords: Apple, Google, Revenue, Earnings, Q3 2015, Fortune 500
article_metadata.sailthru.title: Will Apple rally next week like Google did on Friday?
article_metadata.description: Google's market cap gain Friday was a record. Apple is unlikely to match it Tuesday, no matter how much its earnings exceed expectations.
article_metadata.sailthru.description: "Thursday’s report marked the first time since 2013 that Google has announced quarterly adjusted earnings per share higher than expectations." —Bloomberg

og.title: Why Apple won't rally next week like Google did on Friday
